title: strategy announced lead wales lockdown
story: The framework will help to determine when the strict stay-at-home restrictions can begin to be relaxed in Wales and will help to find a way for people in Wales to live and work alongside coronavirus.A Wales-wide programme of surveillance, case identication, and contract tracing is being developed through the office of the Chief Medical Officer, Dr Frank Atherton. This will highlight the importance of community testing and support the containment of emerging coronavirus infections as and when restrictions are eased.Launching the framework, the First Minister said: ldquoOur approach to date has been one of lockdown. We have taken unprecedented steps to protect everyone, but particularly those most at risk from serious illness.ldquoThis has helped the NHS prepare and cope with coronavirus and, even though we have sadly seen more than  people die, it has helped to save many more lives. But this strategy comes with its own costs to peoplersquos wider health and wellbeing and long-term costs to our economy.ldquoWe are keeping these regulations under constant review. We know coronavirus will be with us for a long time yet but we want to see whether there are things we can do while we continue to tackle the virus and while the search for better treatments and a vaccine continue.The framework ndash and the seven questions ndash will help determine when the time is right to relax some of the stay-at home regulations.The seven questions are:bull Would easing a restriction have a negative effect on containing the virus bull Does a particular measure pose a low risk of further infection bull How can it be monitored and enforced bull Can it be reversed quicklyit creates unintended consequences bull Does it have a positive economic benefit bull Does it have a positive impact on peoplersquos wellbeing bull Does it have a positive impact on equality The Chief Medical Officer for Walesrsquo office has developed the Wales-wide programme of surveillance, case identication, and contract tracing.It will have four main strands ndash improved surveillance of cases of coronavirus effective identication of cases and contact tracing learning from international experience and engaging with the public.Dr Atherton said: ldquoAction to ease the lockdown restrictions will need to be supported by a comprehensive public health response, which will need to developed quickly and at scale.ldquoAcross the UK, we have worked and put in place unprecedented measures to contain and delay the spread of coronavirus. We have also worked to reduce the overall impact of the virus by strengthening essential services, including healthcare.ldquoWe are now working towards a new recovery phase to lead us out of the pandemic but only when the conditions are right.The First Minister added: ldquoCoronavirus is not going to disappear ndash it is likely it will be with us for a long time. We will need to have some sort of restrictions in place for some time yet to continue to control the spread of the virus and reduce community transmission. This framework will help us determine what is right for Wales.ldquoThere is a long road ahead of us towards recovery to pre-pandemic levels, butwe continue to work together, I hope we will be able to make changes to the restrictions and see a gradualto something resembling normal le.The Welsh Government has worked closely with the rest of the UK throughout the pandemic and has shared the development of the framework with the Scottish, Northern Irish and the UK governments. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log -- s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a commentOrder byOldest firstNewest firstHighest scoredLowest scoredLoading comments... title: no new coronavirus cases recorded vale
story: No further deaths caused by the virus have been recorded in Penarth and the surrounding areas since last Wednesday and the total still stands at .On Tuesday, there were no new cases of the virus in the Cardf and Vale University Health Board for the first time since March , the earliest date for which there is data.Across Wales, another  confirmed cases of Covid- were reported yesterday and  people died.That brings the total number of cases in Wales to ,.Public Health Walesrsquo Dr Giri Shankar said: ldquoWe have been working hard to increase our testing capacity, and in the last week we have more than doubled our capacity to , tests a day in Wales. We know there is more to do as demand increases, and we will continue to ramp up this capacity.Social care workers are calling for the Welsh Government to mass test residents in care homes where the death toll continues to rise across the country.Local resident, Hayley Lawrence, has started a petition asking the Welsh Government to increase its testing programme in care homes throughout Wales.The Welsh Government has said that testing capacity in Wales currently stands at , a day but it ldquowill be increased to up to , tests a day by drawing on a UK-wide scheme.Yesterday the Health Minister Vaughan Gething announced a new plan to test and trace the spread of the virus.The plan includes increasing testing of critical workers to enable them toto work a new system of home testing for the publicthey have coronavirus symptoms and a new app to track symptoms in the general population and contact others who have symptoms or have tested positive. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log -- s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: china barley tariff deeply disappointing   australian minister
story: The tarfs that took effect on Tuesday come a week after China banned beef imports from Australiarsquos four largest abattoirs over labelling issues.Trade Minister Simon Birmingham rejects Chinarsquos claim that barley is subsidised by the Australian government.Mr Birmingham also says Australia could appeal to the World Trade Organisation to resolve the beef and barley disputes.Birmingham said he had tried without success to speak to his Chinese counterpart Zhong Shan for the past week.In Beijing, foreign ministry spokesman Zhao Lijian said China was looking into trade issues between the countries ldquoin accordance with related laws and World Trade Organisation rules. vw,vw,px, px"Australian beef on sale at a supermarket in Beijing. China has suspended beef imports from four Australian slaughterhouses Australian barley farmer Andrew Weidemann said the tarf barrier ldquostops the trade completely with Australiarsquos biggest customer.Mr Weidemann estimated the tarfs would cost the Australian economy more than  million Australian dollars .He said China had been investigating Australian barley for  months, but Australiarsquos call for a coronavirus inquiry ldquodidnrsquot help.Meanwhile Australia has welcomed international support for an independent coronavirus pandemic investigation.The World Health Organisationbowed to calls on Monday from most of its member states to launch an independent probe into how it managed the international response to the coronavirus.The ldquocomprehensive evaluation sought by a coalition of African, European and other countries including Australia, is intended to review ldquolessons learned from WHOrsquos coordination of the global response to Covid-.But it would stop short of looking into contentious issues such as the origins of the respiratory virus.Australian Foreign Minister Marise Payne had earlier welcomed the apparent majority support for the motion, saying her government wanted the inquiry to be ldquoimpartial, independent and comprehensive.Australia is seen as a leader in rallying global support for an inquiry, attracting Chinese criticism that it is parroting the United States and inviting a Chinese boycott of exports and services. vw,vw,px, px"Australian Foreign Minister Marise Payne speaks to reporters in Sydney on Tuesday Australian government critics have argued that Prime Minister Scott Morrisonrsquos conservative administration should have gathered allies before antagonising Australiarsquos most important trading partner.The trade dispute is the first time Beijing has used access to its huge markets as leverage in its campaign to deflect blame for the outbreak.In other coronavirus-related developments in the Asia-Pacic region, South Korea reported only  fresh cases on Tuesday, a possible sign that a recent outbreak in the Seoul area was stabilising, as officials prepare to reopen schools.Nine of the new cases were from Seoul and nearby regions, where dozens of infections have been linked to clubgoers who went out in early May as the country began relaxing social distancing measures.Deputy Health Minister Kim Gang-lip urged vigilance to maintain hard-won gains against the virus and called for education officials to double check preventive measures with high-school seniors ing to school on Wednesday.China reported seven new coronavirus cases, a day after Chinese President Xi Jinping announced his country would provide  billionto help respond to the outbreak and its economic fallout.Three of the new cases were listed as imported. Two were registered as local infections in Jilin province, and another local case was identied in Hubei province, whose capital Wuhan is where the pandemic began late last year.Mr Xirsquos appearance via video link at the World Health Assembly came amid finger-pointing between the US and China over the pandemic and WHO bowing to calls to launch an independent probe into how it managed the response to the coronavirus.China has repeatedly said now is not the time for such an investigation, especially one that could look into allegations it for suppressed information and bungled its response to the initial outbreak..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: China barley tarf  udeeply disappointing u  u Australian minister article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log -- s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a commentOrder byOldest firstNewest firstHighest scoredLowest scoredLoading comments... title: launches investigation handling pandemic
story: The move comes after weeks of finger-pointing between the US and China over the pandemic, which has killed more than , people and devastated the global economy.The ldquocomprehensive evaluation, sought by a coalition of African, European and other countries, is intended to review ldquolessons learned from WHOrsquos coordination of the global response to Covid-.But it would stop short of examining contentious issues such as the origins of the new coronavirus.US President Donald Trump has claimed he has proof suggesting the coronavirus originated in a lab in China, while the scientic community has insisted all evidence to date shows the virus likely jumped into humans from animals.In Washington on Monday, Mr Trump criticised the WHO for having done ldquoa very sad job and said he was considering whether to cut the annual US funding of the body from  milliona year to  million .ldquoThey gave us a lot of bad advice, terrible advice, he said. ldquoThey were wrong so much, always on the side of China. vw,vw,px, px"Later on Monday, Mr Trump tweeted a letter he had sent WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus in which the president said ldquothe only way forward wasWHO ldquocan actually demonstrate independence from China.Mr Trump said unless WHO committed to ldquosubstantive improvements over the next  days he would make his temporary suspension of US funding permanent.WHOrsquos normally bureaucratic annual assembly this week has been overshadowed by mutual recriminations and political sniping between the US and China. to obtain the information that the world needed and that failure cost many lives" data-source"US Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar"Mr Trump has repeatedly attacked WHO, claiming it helped China conceal the extent of the coronavirus pandemic in its early stages. Several Republican politicians have called on Dr Tedros to resign.US Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar said on Monday it was time to be frank about why Covid- has ldquospun out of control.ldquoThere was a failure by this organisation to obtain the information that the world needed and that failure cost many lives, Mr Azar said.Speaking hours after Chinese President Xi Jinping announced China would provide  billionto help respond to the outbreak and its economic fallout, Mr Azar said the US had allocated  billionto coronavirus containment efforts around the world.Dr Tedros said he would launch an independent evaluation of WHOrsquos response ldquoat the earliest appropriate moment mdash alluding to findings published on Monday in a first report by an oversight advisory body commissioned to look into WHOrsquos response. vw,vw,px, px"President Donald Trump has been pointing the finger at the WHO and at China The -page report raised questions such as whether WHOrsquos warning system for alerting the world to outbreaks is adequate, and suggested member states might need to ldquoreassess WHOrsquos role in providing travel advice to countries.In his opening remarks at the WHO meeting, Dr Tedros held firm and sought to focus on the bigger troubles posed by the outbreak, saying ldquowe have been humbled by this very small microbe.ldquoThis contagion exposes the fault lines, inequalities, injustices and contradictions of our modern world, Dr Tedros said. ldquoAnd geopolitical isions have been thrown into sharp relief.China, meanwhile, sought to ert attention to its renewed efforts to slow the coronavirus pandemic, with Mr Xi announcing the  billion outlay over two years to fight it. Last year, China donated some  millionto the WHO.US National Security Council spokesman John Ullyot characterised Chinarsquos newly announced contribution as ldquoa token to distract from calls from a growing number of nations demanding accountability for the Chinese governmentrsquos failure to meet its obligations.He said since China was ldquothe source of the outbreak, it had ldquoa special responsibility to pay more and give more. vw,vw,px, px"President Xi Jinping insists China has acted openly and honestly over the coronavirus outbreak Mr Xi insisted China had acted with ldquoopenness, transparency and responsibility when the epidemic was detected in Wuhan.He said China had give all relevant outbreak data to WHO and other countries, including the virusrsquos genetic sequence, ldquoin a most timely fashion.Mr Xi said that in recent weeks China had dispatched medical supplies to more than  African countries and that  Chinese medical teams were currently on the continent helping local officials.Other world leaders including the presidents of France, South Korea and South Africa and Germanyrsquos chancellor were also piped in to throw their support to the WHO, which has been put on the defensive from a Trump administration that has blamed it for mishandling the outbreak and showering excessive praise on Chinarsquos response.The European Union and others staked out a middle ground.Mr Xi has said China supports the idea of a comprehensive review of the global response to Covid- and that it should be ldquobased on science and professionalism led by WHO, and title: jobs go energy supplier ovo buys sse
story: Ovo will ask its staff to apply for voluntary redundancy as it tries to shed , roles after the coronavirus crisis forced it to speed up integration plans, it said on Tuesday.Around eight in  of these will be among the workers who came to Ovo as part of its pound million deal to buy SSErsquos retail arm.The lionrsquos share of the lost jobs will be among those who work out in the field, such as meter readers and home service engineers.ldquoThere is never an easy time to announce redundancies and this is a particularly dficult decision to take. But like all businesses, we face a new reality and need to adapt quickly to enable us to better-serve our customers and invest in a zero carbon future, said chief executive Stephen Fitzpatrick.Ovo said that the Covid- outbreak, which has forced many of its fieldworkers to stay at home, has accelerated changes that were already happening in the energy sector.For instance, customers are now being forced to read their own meters.ldquoWe are seeing a rapid increase in customers using digital channels to engage with us and, in our experience, once customers start to engage dferently they do not go back. As a result, we are expecting a permanent reduction in demand for some roles whilst other field-based roles are also heavily affected, Mr Fitzpatrick said.Mr Fitzpatrick was expected to share the news in a live online town hall with thousands of employees on Tuesday morning.It is a big change for the Ovo founder, who has been more used to hiring people than firing them since setting the firm up in .Already among the biggest challengers on the energy market, Mr Fitzpatrickrsquos business ballooned to become Britainrsquos second biggest energy supplier after acquiring SSE.At the time of the takeover was announced last September, Pete Wishart, MP for Perth and North Perthshire, said that he had been reassured during a meeting with SSE that there would be no job losses.Ovo will also close two offices, in Glasgow and Reading, that it acquired as part of the SSE deal and a third, in Selkirk, that joined Ovo when it rescued Spark Energy in .The staff at these sites will be moved to new offices or be allowed to work from home..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: , jobs to go after energy supplier Ovo buys SSE article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log -- s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: sean hegarty marathon fundraiser vandalised school
story: ABC: Recycling centres to be discussedMan and woman taken to hospital after three vehicle crashNewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoLestyleCarsHomes and GardensNewsPeopleSean Hegarty in marathon fundraiser for vandalised schoolComedian Sean Hegarty is swapping the stand-up routines for running shoes this weekend in a bid to raise funds for a school hit by a vandalism attack.By The NewsroomFriday, th May , : pmUpdated Friday, th May , : pm""Sean Hegarty : User Sean will be running . milesto raise funds to help with repairs at Tullygally Primary School where thousands of pounds worth of damage was caused when windows were shot out with a pellet gun.For Sean it will be his first marathon in  years - his last was the Belfast marathon - and he assures us he’s looking forward to beating the time he set all those years ago.Of course, he’s not starting from scratch as he’s been running since January and attends Fitzone SRG at St Anthony’s, Craigavon, with his son - giving him a chance to spend more time with the youngster and get fit together.He said: “I’ve been building up the distance over the past few weeks and this gives me an opportunity to push myself and raise funds for a school I run past every day.”He’s aiming to raise £, for the school which was damaged sometime on Wednesday night Thursday morning with a number of windows broken using a pellet gun.Sean is a winner of Ireland’s Funniest Joke  and star of Ireland’s Got Talent. He is known as his alter-ego, comedy character ‘Rodney’, and has racked up over  million video views online. A writer, event host, presenter on Cool FM, podcaster, actor and comedian, Sean and his we actress Diona Doherty Hegarty have now branched into writing and before lockdown had been commissioned to write five stage shows.The couple also had a viral video a few years back - the Derry Londonderry hitchhiker sketch from BBC NI’s ‘Late Licence’ show.Now Sean won’t be hitching any lts tomorrow morning as he undertakes his marathon at the lakes - and he’s hoping to beat his four and a half hour time from  years ago.To support his fundraising effort visit GoFundMe and please give generously!A message from the Editor:Thank you for reading this story on our website. Gosford has been open and it is open to local people but becausethe car parkwas not open we were encouraging people to come and park on the hard shoulder.“It will cost £, to put traffic cones along that hard shoulder.”In response, the Council’s Strategic Director of People, Mark Parkinson said: “In respect of cones we will liaisewith the Police. I would totally agree the use of cones on this hard shoulderis fundamental and has made a dference previously.”Alderman Jim Speers said it “is only a matter of time before tragedy happens on that road” and called for a “permanent solution” to be found for this issue.“I must say, as members will be aware, I have raised this point on many occasions,” said the Ulster Unionist Party’s Cusher Councillor.“I have seen the cars parked on the main road but yesterdaythere were  to  cars parked down at the chapel crossroads as well.“It is only a matter of time before some tragedy happens on that road.“I have seen kids getting out of cars and kids running around and I have seen it on many occasions. story: Long traffic queue as motorists wait for Sunday lunchCost of Gosford forest cones revealedNewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoLestyleCarsHomes and GardensNewsPoliticsRecycling centres open - here’s what you need to knowFour recycling centres in ArmaghCity. Banbridge and Craigavon Borough Council will reopen today .By The NewsroomMonday, th May , : am""A statement on Armagh, Banbridge and Craiagvon Borough Council’s website says that following an announcement by the NI Executive last week, a number of householdrecycling centres are to open from noon..The Station Road, recycling centre in Armagh, the Scarva Road centre in Banbridge, the New Line centre in Lurgan and the Fairgreen centre in Portadown will all open from  noon – pm today .From Tuesday to Friday of this week, these centres will be open from am to pm. On Saturdaythe centres will be open for NHS and Care Workers only from am to  noon.Please note, late entry to the centres will be  minutes before closing time.The only material being accepted at the centres at present is the disposal of additional bagged household waste and organic garden waste that cannot be stored at home, at this time.The council has plans to extend the material that can be deposited at the recycling centres and will open more sites across the borough when it can do safely.To protect users and staff, the following temporary restrictions have been put in place. Only essential bagged household waste and bagged garden waste will be permitted users must offload waste unaided and council staff will be on hand to offer guidance only.The public have been asked to cooperate with staff at all times and warned that abusive behaviour will not be tolerated.Only residents of the borough will be permitted access to the recycling centres and photographicID may be required. No vans, pick up vans or trailers will be accepted as the sites are open for cars only.Commercial users are not permitted and are asked to contact trade.waste@armaghbanbridgecraigavon.gov.uk to arrange a collection.The Council has also advised that free Bulky Waste Collection service is now running as normal.Anyone wishing to book a collection should call   .A message from the Editor:Thank you for reading this story on our website.
